content:
Some people were failing validators 9 & 10 while passing all the tests, so I added two extra (middle sized) tests to help with debugging. The validators are just renames of the tests. They were tested against my solutions in 8 languages with no issues.

10
import J
import H
import D
import A
import I
import C
import B
import F
import G
import E
5
A requires F, J, E
D requires H
E requires J, F
G requires A, I, H
J requires H, G

and

10
import I
import A
import D
import C
import G
import H
import B
import F
import E
import J
9
A requires H
B requires G
C requires D
D requires J
E requires I, G
G requires I, F
H requires J
I requires F
J requires I

Changed difficulty from easy to medium due to very low success rate (<33%). Also added multiple library requirements in test 3 (before you had to wait until test 6 to realize that a library may have more than one requirements).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is an incredibly well crafted easy level puzzle. Exactly what we have come to expect from @Rafarafa! Goal is clear. Test cases are extensive. Great job!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good easy puzzle to work with graphs, statement is clear and the tests seems to cover everything.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I hope this will get accepted. Don't know why i'm the first one to approve it
Nice job! Upvoted

New things:

- Updated tags
- Random library picture from: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2022/01/the-most-popular-us-library-books-of-2021/
- Changed my solution and uploaded the generator logic here: https://github.com/daxida/CodinGame-contributions/tree/main/library-dependencies

Other than that it's the same and I think I cannot make it more tricky due to codingame input constraints.
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
This puzzle made my day. Good job!
Nice job! Upvoted
Nice job! Upvoted
Looks good to me, well done!

Thanks for the puzzle!

I'd suggest to be more precise on the dependency relations (or at least give an example with several dependencies on a single input line).

Goal section
* Please specify the output format for point (2,1).

* Please specify that each line of output contains one output message. (That is, we are not joining all messages as one line.)

Input section
* Please change "Next lines" to "Next line".

Constraints section
* Please state the lower bounds too.
* Please change "Number of modules" to [[n_imp]].
* Please change "Dependencies" to [[n_dep]].
* Suggest to change 200 to 100 as no input is greater than 100.

Cases
* I believe you will revise the duplicate cases?

Thanks.

I'm not entirely sure I understand this: ''Please specify that each line of output contains one output message. (That is, we are not joining all messages as one line.)''. Other than that I fixed everything but the cases which I'm about to do now. Thanks!

Oh and also here ''Please change "Dependencies" to [[n_dep]].''. It turns out it's not really [[n_dep]] but the actual number of edges of the graph (since for each of the [[n_dep]] lines we can have 1 or more edges etc.).

edit: fixed the duplicate cases.

I don't agree on this. Difficulty of a puzzle doesn't rely on the success rate, but on the concepts you have to use to solve it. Basic if/else/for is enough to solve this puzzle. 

Please consider getting this and "fix the spaces" puzzles back into easy puzzles, even if they are in the "hard" part of easy puzzles. 

People who validated it, me included, validated it as an easy puzzle. Please fix it, at least for this one, or i will do it.
And success rate is now 48% by the way.

Thank you for making the changes and clarifying!

Goal section
* For point 2.1, please specify the format of the suggested order too, e.g.
{{import }}[[library]]

* The point you are not sure about: let me explain with an example. In the "Reordering" Test, the output should consist of 5 log messages output in 5 lines instead of in 4 or fewer lines. However, the current statement does not mention that there should only be one log message per line.

Constraints section
* Is it better just to change all < to ≤? There are some cases where n_dep = 2.

* Oh, and there is one case where n_dep = 1.

Thanks again.
I think it's clearer now? Not entirely sure. I did fix the constraints thanks!
Maybe add ", one log message per line" at the end of Output section?
Sure thing, done.
